org.grouplens.lenskit.collections

Class LongKeyDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.collections.LongKeyDomain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by LongKeyIndex.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class LongKeyDomain
extends Object
implements Serializable

    Implement a domain of long keys, sorted by key. Keys can be mapped back to indexes and vice versa; it has a fixed domain, and a bitmask of active entries. This is a helper class for implementing LongSortedArraySet, SparseVector, etc. This class should not be directly used outside of the LensKit data structures.

    A key set has a domain, which is the set of all possible keys that it can contain. These keys are stored in an array. The active keys are those that are actually in the set. Active/inactive status is tracked with a bitmask.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Compatibility
    Private

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public static LongKeyDomain wrap(long[] keys,
                                 int size,
                                 boolean initiallyActive)
        Deprecated. 

        Wrap a key array (with a specified size) into a key set.

        Parameters:
        keys - The key array. This array must be sorted, and must not contain duplicates. For efficiency, this condition is not checked unless assertions are enabled. Since this method is only intended to be used when implementing test cases or other data structures, callers of this method should ensure sortedness and throw the appropriate exception.
        size - The length of the array to actually use.
        initiallyActive - true to activate all keys initially, false to leave them inactive.
        Returns:
        The key set.

      • fromCollection

        public static LongKeyDomain fromCollection(Collection<Long> keys,
                                           boolean initiallyActive)
        Deprecated. 

        Create a key set from a collection of keys.

        Parameters:
        keys - The key collection.
        initiallyActive - true if the elements of the key set should be initially activated; false to make all keys initially inactive.
        Returns:
        The key set.

        Returns:

      • getIndex

        public abstract int getIndex(long key)
        Deprecated. 

        Get the index for a key, regardless of its active state.

        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:
        The index, or a negative value if the key is not in the domain. Such a negative value is the insertion point, as defined by Arrays.binarySearch(long[], int, int, long).

      • getIndexIfActive

        public int getIndexIfActive(long key)
        Deprecated. 

        Get the index for a key if that key is active.

        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:
        The index, or a negative value if the key is not in the domain or is inactive.

      • upperBound

        public int upperBound(long key)
        Deprecated. 

        Get the upper bound, the first index whose key is greater than the specified key.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The first index greater than the specified key, or domainSize() if the key is the last key in the domain. The index is not necessarily active.

      • lowerBound

        public int lowerBound(long key)
        Deprecated. 

        Get the lower bound, the first index whose key is greater than or equal to the specified key. This method is paired with upperBound(long); the interval [lowerBound(k),upperBound(k)) contains the index of k, if the key is in the domain, and is empty if the key is not in the domain.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The index of the first key greater than or equal to key.

      • clone

        public LongKeyDomain clone()
        Deprecated. 

        Return a copy of this key set. The resulting key set has an independent mask. Key storage is shared for efficiency.

        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        The copied key set.

      • unowned

        public LongKeyDomain unowned()
        Deprecated. 

        Mark this key set as unowned. The next call to clone() will mark the key set as owned and return it rather than making a copy. This allows code to avoid an extra copy when creating a key set to pass off to another method or object that will make a defensive copy.

        You almost certainly do not want to call this method.

        Any object or method that receives a key set that it intends to take ownership of must call clone() to make sure that it owns the set.

        Returns:
        This key set (for chaining).

      • acquire

        public void acquire()
        Deprecated. 

        Mark the key set as owned, but don’t copy it. Used by views to make sure that someone owns the key set.

      • inactiveCopy

        public LongKeyDomain inactiveCopy()
        Deprecated. 

        Return a copy of this key set that is entirely inactive.

        Returns:
        The new key set, with the same keys but all of them deactivated.

      • compactCopy

        public LongKeyDomain compactCopy()
        Deprecated. 

        Make a compact copy of this key set. In a compact copy, the key array has no extra storage and only the active keys are retained. All keys are active in the resulting set.

        Returns:
        A compacted copy of this key set.

      • compactCopy

        public LongKeyDomain compactCopy(boolean active)
        Deprecated. 

        Make a compact copy of this key set. In a compact copy, the key array has no extra storage and only the active keys are retained.

        Parameters:
        active - Whether the keys should be active or inactive in the compacted key set.
        Returns:
        A compacted copy of this key set.

      • activeIndexIterator

        public IntBidirectionalIterator activeIndexIterator(boolean mayBeModified)
        Deprecated. 

        Get an iterator over active indexes.

        Parameters:
        mayBeModified - Whether the set’s active/inactive flags may be modified during iteration. If false, this method is slightly more efficient; if true, the iterator will iterate over a snapshot of the current active/inactive state.
        Returns:
        An iterator over active indexes.

      • activeIndexIterator

        public IntBidirectionalIterator activeIndexIterator(int min,
                                                    int max,
                                                    int idx)
        Deprecated. 

        Get an iterator over active indexes, initialized to the specified index and limited to a particular range.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum index for the iterator.
        max - The maximum index for the iterator.
        idx - The starting index for the iterator. The iterator can go backwards from this index, if it is greater than min.
        Returns:
        An iterator over active indexes.

      • modifiableActiveSetView

        public LongSortedSet modifiableActiveSetView()
        Deprecated. 

        Get a view of this key set as a set that supports limited mutation. The set can have items removed (using methods such as remove(Object), rem(long), removeAll(Collection), and retainAll(Collection)), and those removals will be reflected by marking the associated entries as inactive in the key set.

        Returns:
        A view of this key set as a set with limited mutation capabilities.
        See Also:
        activeSetView()

      • getActiveMask

        public BitSet getActiveMask()
        Deprecated. 

        Get the active keys as a bit set. The returned bit set must not be modified.

        Returns:
        The active bit mask. Do not modify this bit set.

      • isCompatibleWith

        public abstract boolean isCompatibleWith(@Nonnull
                                         LongKeyDomain other)
        Deprecated. 

        Query whether this key set is compatible with another. Two key sets are compatible if indexes are compatible (that is, the same index will refer to the same key). This method is conservative and efficient; it may claim that two sets are incompatible even if indexes may compatible. Key sets generated with clone() are compatible with their parent and each other.

        Parameters:
        other - The other key set.
        Returns:
        true if the two key sets are compatible.

      • invert

        public LongKeyDomain invert()
        Deprecated. 

        Invert the active status of all keys in the set. The set is modified in place; it is just returned for chaining.

        Returns:
        this (for chaining).

      • setAllActive

        public LongKeyDomain setAllActive(boolean active)
        Deprecated. 

        Set the active status of all entries in the key set.

        Parameters:
        active - true to activate, false to deactivate.
        Returns:
        The key set (for chaining).
